data.title: Obituaries – Ellwood City, PA news
data.text:
Mrs. Patricia (Main) Rukovena, 77, of Ellwood City passed away on Sunday, August 25th, 2024 at Quality Life Services in New Castle.

Mrs. Rukovena was born the daughter of the late Chester K. and Teressa (DeBlasio) Main in Ellwood City on October 29th, 1946. She had graduated from Riverside High School with the class of 1966. Patty was Catholic by faith, a homemaker, an avid Pittsburgh Steeler’s fan, and loved spending time with her grandchildren.

Patty is survived by her son Michael “Beno” Rukovena of Ellwood City, grandchildren Joseph Lyle, Tyler Lyle, and Addison Yaromey, great-grandson Riley Lyle, sister Karen Ruth (Roderick) Jackson of New Brighton, and her brother Kenneth P. Main of North Sewickley Township.

She was preceded in death by her parents, daughter Amy Yaromey, sister Susan Main, and brother David Main.

Following Patricia’s wishes there will not be a public service. Inurnment will be at the Locust Grove Cemetery. The final arrangements are entrusted to the Samuel Teolis Funeral Home and Crematory Inc..

Mrs. Joyce Jean Cappello, 75, of Ellport passed away unexpectedly at her residence on Thursday, August 22nd, 2024.

Mrs. Cappello was born in Ellwood City on October 10th, 1948. She is a member of the Lincoln High School class of 1966. She married her loving husband of 56 years Dennis W. Cappello on February 3rd, 1968. Over the years, Joyce had worked at Mom’s Pies which was located in Frisco as a baker and later at Giant Eagle in the Deli Department. She was a great homemaker and enjoyed gardening, doing yardwork, and loved all her pets.

She is survived by her husband Dennis, daughter Amy Cappello Lutz of Ellport, son Dave Cappello of Ellwood City, and her grandchildren Isaac and Isaiah Lutz, and Carson Cappello.

Following Joyce’s wishes there will not be a public service. The final arrangements are entrusted to the Samuel Teolis Funeral Home and Crematory Inc..

John P. Novalesi, 90, of Ellwood City (formerly of Wampum) passed away Thursday, August 22, 2024 at Cambridge Falls following a brief illness.

Born February 14, 1934 in Wampum, he was the son of the late Emilio and Emma Barrichini Novalesi. He was married to Marlene J. Karner Novalesi for 28 years when she passed in 1985.

John graduated from Wampum High School 1953, where he was named as an All-State Basketball Player. He then went to St. Francis College in Loretto PA on a full basketball scholarship earning his bachelor’s degree. After graduating college, he taught US History at Riverside High School for 30 years from their conception until his retirement. John was the first basketball coach for their program. In 2007, he was inducted into the Lawrence County Sports Hall of Fame. He started the first Youth for America Club which started the first recycling program in the area. He served as the superintendent of the recycling program after his retirement from teaching. While teaching he worked construction for many summers with Tony Yannielo. He was a member of the Divine Grace Parish Holy Redeemer Church in Ellwood City, F&AM 599, and the New Castle Consistory. John enjoyed playing the accordion and polka dancing at the SNPJ.

Survivors include fiancée, Carol Ferrigno of Koppel; son, John E. Novalesi of Wampum; four daughters, Marla Jo (Ken) Clem of New Castle, Lori Anne (John) Thomas of San Diego, Carole S. (David) Houghton of Ellwood City, and Shari L. Schmeltz of Phoenix; 10 grandchildren, and 8 great-grandchildren with one on the way.

The last of his family he was preceded in death by his parents, wife Marlene; daughter Lisa M. Simpson; three brothers, Mario, Merino, and Dean, and his sister Mary Sharek.

Visiting hours will be held on Sunday August 25, 2024 from 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm and from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm at the Marshall Funeral Home, 341 Main Street Wampum.

A blessing service will be held at the Funeral Home, on August 26, 2024 at 11:00 am with Father Joseph Freedy officiating.

Interment will follow in Holy Redeemer Cemetery.

Memorial Contributions may be made to the Maguire Home in New Brighton.

Online condolences may be sent to marshallsfh.com

Mary E. Ringle, 63, of Ellwood City passed away at UPMC Presbyterian in Pittsburgh on Tuesday, August 20, 2024. She was the daughter of the late William and RaeAnna (Shinsky) Edinger and was born March 24, 1961, in Ellwood City.

She is survived by her husband, of 42 years, James Ringle of Ellwood City, her son; Randy Ringle of Ellwood City, her grandson; Lincoln Ringle, one brother; John Edinger of Ellwood City, and three sisters; Linda Linderman and her husband Charles, Carol Kennedy and her husband Ron both of Ellwood City and Susan Harris of New Castle.

Mary was a 1979 graduate of Riverside High School. She met and married the love of her life Jim Ringle on April 24, 1982, and they were married 42 years. Mary loved helping people and enjoyed being around people. Jim and Mary enjoyed going to Koehler Brewery and enjoyed their nightly music. They had one son, Randy. Mary was a loving wife, mother, sister, and grandmother and she never met a stranger, and she was truly a friend to all.

She is preceded in death by her sister; Margaret Edinger, and one brother; William “Billy” Edinger.

A Memorial Service for Mary will be held at 1:30PM on August 31, 2024, at the First Christian Church located at 317 PA-288 in Ellwood City, with Pastor Reid Moon, Officiating.

Arrangements entrusted to the TUNRER-HYDE FUNERAL & CREMATION SERVICES located at 6th and Park in Ellwood City.

Sharon A. Petrocelli, 71, of Ellwood City passed away unexpectedly on Monday, August 19, 2024 at UPMC Presbyterian Hospital.

Born June 24, 1953 in Pittsburgh, she was the daughter of Shirley Kratsas. She married Walter S. Petrocelli on September 28, 1974.

Sharon graduated from Perry High School in Pittsburgh and then from the Pittsburgh Beauty Academy. She was a member of the former BVM Church and current member of Divine Grace Parish Holy Redeemer Church in Ellwood City. Through the years, Sharon worked at Kaufman’s in Pittsburgh, at McDonald’s for 16 years, and in the bakery at the Monaca Walmart. She loved being a mom and was a lifelong dog lover, including her beloved dog, Suzie. Love was the cornerstone of her life.

Survivors include her husband Walter; son, John V. (Lina) Petrocelli of Cornelius, NC; daughter, Connie (Tom) Beatty of Hermitage, and her granddaughter, Sydney Petrocelli.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her grandmother Anna Kuntz and her uncle Fred Kuntz.

Visiting hours will be held on Friday August 23, 2024 from 5:30 pm until the Celebration of Life Service at 7:00 pm at the Marshall Funeral Home, 200 Fountain Ave. Ellwood City.

Memorial Contributions may be made to St. Jude Hospital.

Online condolences may be sent to marshallsfh.com

Mr. Terry L. Froce Sr., 75, of Ellwood City passed away on Sunday, August 18th, 2024 at the UPMC Presbyterian Hospital.

Terry was born on November 15th, 1948 in Ellwood City to the late Louis S. and Marjorie (Averill) Froce. He attended Lincoln High School and briefly served in the United Sates Air Force. Terry worked at the General Shale Brickyard as a setter and later as a kilm operator. Terry enjoyed being active in activities such as fishing, bowling, golfing, and hunting.

He is survived by his wife, Gloria (Hairhoger) Froce whom he married on June 18th, 1968, daughter, Chrissie May Froce of Ellwood City, brother, Brian Froce of Ellwood City, grandchildren, Noelle (Frank Miller) Froce, Maxton Froce, and Jason Williams, and great-granddaughter, Sophia Miller.

He was preceded in death by his parents, son Terry L. Froce Jr. in 2021 and his brother Neil Froce.

Visitation will be held on Friday, August 23rd, from 4-7, and on Saturday, August 24th, from 10:00 a.m. until the time of service at 11:00 a.m. at the Samuel Teolis Funeral Home and Crematory Inc, with Pastor Dennis Arndt Officiating. Interment will be at the Locust Grove Cemetery.

Memorial donations in Terry’s name may be made out to the Club Hope Foundation at; 113 Collins Road., Ellwood City, Pa 16117.

Patricia L. “Patty” Gibbs, 54, formerly of North Sewickley Township passed away on Friday, August 16th, 2024 at the UPMC Passavant Hospital in McCandless Township.

Patty was born in Ellwood City on October 5th, 1968 to the late Howard W. and Margaret H. (Weidle) Gibbs. She had graduated from Riverside High School and attended classes at the Community College of Beaver County. She had worked at the Beaver County Human Society and more recently at the Franklin Township Plaza, Giant Eagle. Patty then devoted herself to taking care of her parents. She had a great passion for animals especially her cats Oscar and Macy.

She is survived by her sisters Cynthia Powers of Hopewell, Deborah (Woodrow) Hardy of Wayne Township, and Diane Bradshaw of Neshannock Township, several nieces and nephews, her cousin Bob Cunningham, and good friends Sally Main and Randy Blinn.

Family and friends will be received on Thursday from 4-7 pm at the Samuel Teolis Funeral Home and Crematory Inc.. A private inurnment will take place at the Holy Redeemer Cemetery..

Memorial contributions in Patricia’s name may be made to; Beaver County Humane Society, 3394 Broadhead Rd., Aliquippa, PA 15001, beavercountyhumanesociety.org

Mrs. Mary L. Wilson, 95, of Ellwood City passed away on Saturday, August 17th, 2024 at Edison Manor in New Castle.

Mrs. Wilson was born on March 31st, 1929 in Ellwood City to the late Asher and Nellie McDowell. Over the years she had worked as a nurse’s aide at various healthcare facilities in the area.

She is survived by her daughters and sons-in-law Deborah and Joe Floreno of Macomb, Michigan and Tracy and Tim Pinwell of Pennsylvania, seven grandchildren and four great-grandchildren.

Mary was preceded in death by her parents, her first husband Donald Smith, her second husband Don Wilson, daughter Karen Bentel, son Rodger Smith, and sisters Diane and Doris.

A private family gathering will be held at the Samuel Teolis Funeral Home and Crematory Inc.. Inurnment will follow at the St. Marks Cemetery in Franklin Twp..

Patricia “Pat” Santellan, 71, formerly of Grant, MI passed away on August 13, 2024 at her home in Ellwood City, PA.

You were a pillar of strength and love in our family. Your absence leaves a void, but your spirit and the love you gave us will remain in our hearts. Pat loved her flower garden, spending time with her family and grandchildren. She loved sightseeing and anything outside.

Pat is survived by her husband, Greg Santellan, her children; Julie, Anna, Lori, Stacey, Amanda, and Jason, her siblings; Joann Burk, Marlene Heath, Jennie Vansetters, Linda and Bill Kasul, Angel and Jon Cook, Edward Chatman, Jr and several grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by her parents, Edward and Angeline Chatman, her brother, Frank Chatman and her sister, Mabel VanOs.

A memorial service for Pat will be held on Saturday, August 24, 2024 at noon at Townsend Park, 8280 6 Mile Rd., Northeast Rockford, MI 49341.

Funeral arrangements were entrusted to the Joseph A. Tomon, Jr. Funeral Home & Crematory, 97 Grim Avenue, Ellport.

Mr. Lee A. Nocera, 80, of Ellwood City, passed away on Sunday, August 11th, 2024 at his residence.

Lee was born on April 12th, 1944 in Ellwood City, to the late John and Jessie (Perrotta) Nocera. Lee graduated from Lincoln High School with the class of 1962. After business school, Lee began working for the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Washington, DC, working in the printing department. While working at the FBI, he met Sandra McQauin, whom he later married. Lee and Sandy made Northern Virginia their home, where they raised their four sons. After leaving the FBI, Lee began his 30+ year sales career working in the Printing Industry. Lee worked with various organizations including non-profit organizations, helping to promote their missions. Lee later co-owned and operated his own printing business called “Senco” in Woodbridge, VA.

After retiring from the printing industry and the passing of his late wife, Sandy Nocera, Lee returned to his hometown , Ellwood City, PA to enjoy his retirement. Lee reunited with childhood friend Sandy Fogel and grew their childhood memories into a true love story for the next 20 years. Lee and Sandy enjoyed many family gatherings in their home with both of their families and friends.

Lee is a member of Divine Grace Parish, Holy Redeemer Church, Ellwood City Saxon’s Club, and the Sons of Italy #608. He enjoyed hunting, fishing, restoring antique cars, boating, doing projects around the house, going to church, and was an excellent cook.

Lee is survived by his life-partner, Sandy Fogel, sons, Michael (George Marone) Nocera of Wilmington Delaware, Joseph Nocera of Fredericksburg, Virginia, and James (Christina) Nocera of Manassas Virginia, and grandchildren, Brianna, Lexi, Anthony and Elon Nocera. Nieces, Kimberly Morgan, Jenny Nocera and Nephew, John Nocera.

Lee was preceded in death by his late wife, Sandra (McQuain) Nocera, son, Mark Nocera, daughter-in-law, Melanie Nocera (James Nocera), brother, Michael W. Nocera, sister, Rose Marie Hendricks, and nephew, John Hendricks.

Family and friends will be received at Divine Grace Parish, Holy Redeemer Church on Saturday, August 24th, from 10:00 a.m. until the time of memorial Mass at 11:00 a.m. with Father Joseph Freedy officiating. Funeral arrangements have been entrusted to the Samuel Teolis Funeral Home and Crematory Inc..

Memorial contributions in Lee’s name may be made out to the Club Hope Foundation at; 113 Collins Road., Ellwood City, Pa 16117.

In memory of their father, sons, Michael, Joseph and James and families, will hold a Virginia service at Mountcastle Turch Life Celebration Home in Dale City, VA. A graveside memorial at Lee’s final resting place, Fairfax Memorial Gardens, Fairfax, will follow.
